td.para: An STL file-type is derived from the word "Stereo-lithography." The STL file-type gives the xyz coordinates of the vertices and normals of triangles that describe the surface of the 3D object.
Each triangle is defined by its normal and three points at its vertices. You can have a coarse, fine, or custom number of triangles and vertices.

The number of triangles in the STL file is a balance between unmanageable file-size (too many triangles) and small file-size, (but too few vertices to define the shape well) The optimum is a model in which the model has the appearance of reasonably smooth surfaces, and a manageable file-size.
The STL File should be saved as a Binary file, and typically in meters. You can select the original Units in the CAD-Line dialog when you import the STL file.
